messages.content:
You are a Google Drive data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic Drive file data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Drive schema with:
- files: array of {id, name, mimeType (optional), content (optional text excerpt), modifiedTime (optional)}

Generate Drive files that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events, e.g., documents, reports)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace files)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated files
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious files, 1 = indirect/multi-step file references

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

Generate Drive file data from this world_state:

Sub-scenarios (core events):
[
  {
    "id": "planning_meeting_1",
    "type": "planning_meeting",
    "seed": 847291,
    "abstract_description": "Team planning meeting to discuss project progress and next steps",
    "constraints_hint": "Meeting should be scheduled for next week, during working hours (09:00-18:00), with a duration of 45 minutes. All participants must be available.",
    "planning_window": {
      "week_of": "2025-03-03",
      "timezone": "America/New_York",
      "workday_start": "09:00",
      "workday_end": "18:00"
    },
    "participants": [
      "person_alex_smith",
      "person_jordan_johnson",
      "person_sam_williams"
    ],
    "events": [
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_initial_slack",
        "channel": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T10:12:34-05:00",
        "from": "person_alex_smith",
        "to": [
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "message": "Hey Jordan, Sam – we need to get a planning session on the books for Main Product to go over current progress and next steps for the upcoming sprint. Looking at next week, sometime Mon–Thu during the day. I’ll propose a few options over email so we can check calendars more easily.",
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_email_proposal",
        "channel": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T10:29:10-05:00",
        "from": "person_alex_smith",
        "to": [
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "cc": [],
        "subject": "Planning session for Main Product – find a 45-min slot next week",
        "body": "Hi Jordan and Sam,\n\nWe need a 45-minute planning session next week to review Main Product progress and agree on next steps for the next sprint.\n\nConstraints:\n- Next week (week of March 3)\n- During working hours Eastern (9a–6p)\n- All of us need to be available\n\nLooking at my calendar, I could potentially do:\n- Tue 3/4: 10:00–10:45, 11:30–12:15, or 15:00–15:45\n- Wed 3/5: 09:30–10:15 or 16:00–16:45\n- Thu 3/6: 11:00–11:45\n\nCan you both reply-all with the slots that work for you, and also flag anything I might be missing on your calendars? Once we converge, I’ll send a calendar invite.\n\nThanks,\nAlex",
        "attachments": [],
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_calendar_snapshot_alex",
        "channel": "calendar_export",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T10:35:00-05:00",
        "owner": "person_alex_smith",
        "range_start": "2025-03-03T09:00:00-05:00",
        "range_end": "2025-03-07T18:00:00-05:00",
        "entries": [
          {
            "title": "1:1 with Taylor",
            "start": "2025-03-04T09:30:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-04T10:00:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Eng Standup",
            "start": "2025-03-04T10:45:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-04T11:15:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Design Critique",
            "start": "2025-03-05T10:30:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-05T11:30:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Product Sync",
            "start": "2025-03-06T09:00:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-06T10:00:00-05:00"
          }
        ],
        "notes": "Busy times indicate Alex is unavailable for additional meetings."
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_calendar_snapshot_jordan",
        "channel": "calendar_export",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T10:36:12-05:00",
        "owner": "person_jordan_johnson",
        "range_start": "2025-03-03T09:00:00-05:00",
        "range_end": "2025-03-07T18:00:00-05:00",
        "entries": [
          {
            "title": "Support Rotation",
            "start": "2025-03-04T09:00:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-04T10:30:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Backend Guild",
            "start": "2025-03-04T11:00:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-04T12:00:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Infra Planning",
            "start": "2025-03-05T09:00:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-05T10:00:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "1:1 with Manager",
            "start": "2025-03-05T16:30:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-05T17:00:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Doctor appointment",
            "start": "2025-03-06T10:30:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-06T11:30:00-05:00"
          }
        ],
        "notes": "Jordan generally avoids meetings starting after 5pm ET."
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_calendar_snapshot_sam",
        "channel": "calendar_export",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T10:37:02-05:00",
        "owner": "person_sam_williams",
        "range_start": "2025-03-03T09:00:00-05:00",
        "range_end": "2025-03-07T18:00:00-05:00",
        "entries": [
          {
            "title": "Code Review Block",
            "start": "2025-03-04T15:30:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-04T16:30:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Team Standup",
            "start": "2025-03-05T09:15:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-05T09:45:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Interview Loop",
            "start": "2025-03-05T15:00:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-05T17:00:00-05:00"
          },
          {
            "title": "Errand (OOO)",
            "start": "2025-03-06T11:30:00-05:00",
            "end": "2025-03-06T13:00:00-05:00"
          }
        ],
        "notes": "Sam prefers mornings but can do afternoons except where blocked."
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_jordan_email_reply",
        "channel": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T11:02:44-05:00",
        "from": "person_jordan_johnson",
        "to": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "cc": [],
        "subject": "Re: Planning session for Main Product – find a 45-min slot next week",
        "body": "Thanks Alex.\n\nLooking at my calendar for next week:\n- Tue 3/4: I’m busy 9:00–10:30 and 11:00–12:00, so 10:00–10:45 and 11:30–12:15 don’t really work. I *can* do 15:00–15:45 on Tue.\n- Wed 3/5: I have Infra Planning 9:00–10:00 and would rather not jump directly into another call, but 09:30–10:15 won’t work anyway. 16:00–16:45 is fine for me.\n- Thu 3/6: I’m out late morning for a doctor’s appointment 10:30–11:30, so 11:00–11:45 doesn’t work.\n\nSo my preferences, in order:\n1) Wed 3/5, 16:00–16:45\n2) Tue 3/4, 15:00–15:45\n\nHappy with either.\n\n– Jordan",
        "attachments": [],
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_sam_email_reply",
        "channel": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T11:21:09-05:00",
        "from": "person_sam_williams",
        "to": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson"
        ],
        "cc": [],
        "subject": "Re: Planning session for Main Product – find a 45-min slot next week",
        "body": "Hey both,\n\nFrom Alex’s options:\n- Tue 3/4: I’m clear until 15:30, but I’d rather not run directly into my 15:30–16:30 code review block. 10:00–10:45 or 11:30–12:15 would be fine. 15:00–15:45 is not great for me since it cuts too close.\n- Wed 3/5: I’ve got standup 9:15–9:45 and an interview block 15:00–17:00. So 09:30–10:15 overlaps standup, but 16:00–16:45 doesn’t work either because I’m interviewing then.\n- Thu 3/6: 11:00–11:45 conflicts with an errand I need to run starting 11:30.\n\nSo for me the best slots are:\n1) Tue 3/4, 10:00–10:45\n2) Tue 3/4, 11:30–12:15\n\nIf neither of those works for everyone, we might have to look at a different day/slot.\n\n– Sam",
        "attachments": [],
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_alex_followup_slack",
        "channel": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T11:45:31-05:00",
        "from": "person_alex_smith",
        "to": [
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "message": "Thanks for the replies on email. Looks like:\n- Jordan: Wed 3/5 16:00–16:45 (pref #1), Tue 3/4 15:00–15:45 (pref #2)\n- Sam: Tue 3/4 10:00–10:45 or 11:30–12:15\n\nI’ll scan our calendars again and see if there’s a 45-min slot next week that works for all three of us. May need to go outside the initial list I sent.",
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_alex_personal_scan_note",
        "channel": "internal_note",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T12:02:10-05:00",
        "author": "person_alex_smith",
        "content": "Looking for a 45-min slot next week (Mar 3–7) for planning with Jordan + Sam.\n\nCross-checking calendars:\n- Tue 3/4: \n  * Jordan busy 9:00–10:30, 11:00–12:00\n  * Sam wants to avoid 15:00–15:45 because of 15:30–16:30 code review block\n  * I have a 9:30–10:00 1:1 and 10:45–11:15 standup\n  => No contiguous 45-min where all are free.\n- Wed 3/5:\n  * Jordan busy 9:00–10:00 and 16:30–17:00\n  * Sam busy 9:15–9:45 and 15:00–17:00\n  * I’m busy 10:30–11:30\n  => 16:00–16:45 conflicts with Sam’s interview; mornings also overlap.\n- Thu 3/6:\n  * Jordan 10:30–11:30 appt\n  * Sam 11:30–13:00 errand\n  * I’m 9:00–10:00 Product Sync\n  => Possible 13:00–13:45 window; need to confirm.\n\nTentative: Thu 3/6, 13:00–13:45 ET looks open for all three. Will propose via email and then send calendar invite if they confirm.",
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_alex_email_proposed_slot",
        "channel": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T12:15:55-05:00",
        "from": "person_alex_smith",
        "to": [
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "cc": [],
        "subject": "Re: Planning session for Main Product – proposing Thu 3/6",
        "body": "Hi both,\n\nI looked a bit more broadly at our calendars next week.\n\nThe only 45-minute slot I can find that seems to work for all three of us, within working hours, is:\n- Thu 3/6, 13:00–13:45 ET\n\nCan you please confirm that this time works? If so, I’ll send a calendar invite titled “Main Product – Sprint Planning / Next Steps” and include a short agenda.\n\nBest,\nAlex",
        "attachments": [],
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_jordan_confirmation",
        "channel": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T12:24:03-05:00",
        "from": "person_jordan_johnson",
        "to": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "cc": [],
        "subject": "Re: Planning session for Main Product – proposing Thu 3/6",
        "body": "Thu 3/6, 13:00–13:45 ET works for me.\n\nThanks for doing the calendar Tetris.\n\n– Jordan",
        "attachments": [],
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_sam_confirmation",
        "channel": "email",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T12:28:47-05:00",
        "from": "person_sam_williams",
        "to": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson"
        ],
        "cc": [],
        "subject": "Re: Planning session for Main Product – proposing Thu 3/6",
        "body": "Works for me as well. 13:00–13:45 ET on Thu 3/6 is free on my side.\n\n– Sam",
        "attachments": [],
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_calendar_invite_created",
        "channel": "calendar",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T12:40:12-05:00",
        "organizer": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "event": {
          "title": "Main Product – Sprint Planning / Next Steps",
          "description": "45-minute planning meeting to discuss current progress on Main Product and align on next sprint goals and immediate next steps.\n\nProposed agenda:\n1) Review current sprint status\n2) Identify blockers and dependencies\n3) Agree on scope for next sprint\n4) Assign owners for follow-ups",
          "start": "2025-03-06T13:00:00-05:00",
          "end": "2025-03-06T13:45:00-05:00",
          "location": "Zoom (link in invite)",
          "timezone": "America/New_York"
        },
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "evt_planning_1_final_slack_note",
        "channel": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-24T12:42:33-05:00",
        "from": "person_alex_smith",
        "to": [
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "message": "Invite sent for our Main Product planning: Thu 3/6, 1:00–1:45pm ET. Thanks for juggling calendars – we’ll use it to lock in next sprint goals and immediate next steps.",
        "related_project": "project_main"
      }
    ]
  }
]

  {
    "id": "noise_release_notes_thread",
    "type": "release_planning",
    "seed": 550921,
    "description": "Discussion about preparing release notes for a minor release.",
    "participants": [
      "person_alex_smith",
      "person_jordan_johnson",
      "person_sam_williams"
    ],
    "events": [
      {
        "id": "noise_evt_release_slack_1",
        "channel": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-22T13:15:09-05:00",
        "from": "person_alex_smith",
        "to": [
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "message": "I’m putting together notes for the 2.3.1 patch release. Can you each DM me a quick bullet list of anything user-visible that went out in your areas over the last 2 weeks?",

      },
      {
        "id": "noise_evt_release_slack_2",
        "channel": "slack",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-22T13:19:51-05:00",
        "from": "person_jordan_johnson",
        "to": [
          "person_alex_smith"
        ],
        "message": "- Improved error handling for payment failures\n- Added logging around signup funnel\n- Fixed bug where profile pictures sometimes didn’t load on slow connections",
        "related_project": "project_main"
      },
      {
        "id": "noise_evt_release_doc",
        "channel": "doc",
        "timestamp": "2025-02-22T14:02:28-05:00",
        "author": "person_alex_smith",

raw_message.content:
{
  "files": [
    {
      "id": "file_main_product_sprint_planning_notes_2025_03_06",
      "name": "Main Product – Sprint Planning & Next Steps (2025-03-06)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-03-06T14:10:00-05:00",
      "content": "Main Product – Sprint Planning / Next Steps
Date: Thu, March 6, 2025
Time: 13:00–13:45 ET
Attendees: Alex Smith, Jordan Johnson, Sam Williams

Agenda (from calendar invite):
1) Review current sprint status
2) Identify blockers and dependencies
3) Agree on scope for next sprint
4) Assign owners for follow-ups

Notes
1. Current sprint status
- Frontend: Profile picture loading fixes live; monitoring error rates.
- Backend: Payment failure handling improved; additional logging deployed.
- Infra: No major incidents, but CS-8217 (login after password reset) still open.

2. Blockers & dependencies
- CS-8217 requires infra log access; Jordan to sync with infra on Monday.
- Onboarding flow v3 review on 2025-02-25; any changes may impact next sprint scope.

3. Next sprint tentative scope
- Finalize and ship onboarding v3 experiment.
- Close out auth-related error spikes.
- Improve internal reporting on signup funnel.

4. Action items / owners
- Jordan: Own CS-8217 resolution and report back in next planning.
- Sam: Draft tech plan for auth logging improvements.
- Alex: Update roadmap doc and share with stakeholders.

References
- Roadmap source: “Main Product – 2025 Roadmap (v1.3)” in /Product/Main Product/Roadmap.
- Release history: “Release Notes – v2.3.1” doc.
- Onboarding designs: Figma file "onboarding-flow-v3.fig" (linked from design review invite)."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_main_product_planning_calendar_crosscheck",
      "name": "Main Product – Planning Calendar Cross-check (Mar 3–7, 2025)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-24T12:05:00-05:00",
      "content": "Author: Alex Smith
Created: 2025-02-24 12:02 ET
Purpose: Scratchpad to cross-check availability for 45-min Main Product planning meeting with Jordan + Sam. Used to derive the proposed Thu 3/6 13:00–13:45 ET slot before sending email.

Summary:
- Constraints: Week of March 3, 2025; 09:00–18:00 ET; 45 minutes; all three participants must be available.
- Calendars referenced:
  * Export: Alex – Week of 2025-03-03
  * Export: Jordan – Week of 2025-03-03
  * Export: Sam – Week of 2025-03-03

Key Finding:
- Only viable 45-min block across Tue–Thu is Thu 3/6, 13:00–13:45 ET.

Sheet: Availability Grid (excerpt)
Row headers: Time blocks in 15-min increments.
Columns: Time, Alex, Jordan, Sam, All Free?

Thu 3/6
13:00–13:15 | Alex: Free | Jordan: Free | Sam: Free | All Free: YES
13:15–13:30 | Alex: Free | Jordan: Free | Sam: Free | All Free: YES
13:30–13:45 | Alex: Free | Jordan: Free | Sam: Free | All Free: YES

Decision Note:
Use 3 contiguous free blocks (13:00–13:45) → propose via email as "Main Product – Sprint Planning / Next Steps" and create calendar invite if both confirm."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_main_product_planning_email_drafts",
      "name": "Main Product – Planning Outreach Drafts (Feb 24 2025)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-24T12:18:00-05:00",
      "content": "Internal drafting doc – Alex Smith
Topic: Planning session for Main Product (week of March 3, 2025)

Draft 1 – Initial email (sent as subject: "Planning session for Main Product – find a 45-min slot next week")

Hi Jordan and Sam,

We need a 45-minute planning session next week to review Main Product progress and agree on next steps for the next sprint.

Constraints:
- Next week (week of March 3)
- During working hours Eastern (9a–6p)
- All of us need to be available

Looking at my calendar, I could potentially do:
- Tue 3/4: 10:00–10:45, 11:30–12:15, or 15:00–15:45
- Wed 3/5: 09:30–10:15 or 16:00–16:45
- Thu 3/6: 11:00–11:45

Can you both reply-all with the slots that work for you, and also flag anything I might be missing on your calendars? Once we converge, I’ll send a calendar invite.

Thanks,
Alex

Draft 2 – Follow-up after calendar scan (sent as subject: "Re: Planning session for Main Product – proposing Thu 3/6")

Hi both,

I looked a bit more broadly at our calendars next week.

The only 45-minute slot I can find that seems to work for all three of us, within working hours, is:
- Thu 3/6, 13:00–13:45 ET

Can you please confirm that this time works? If so, I’ll send a calendar invite titled “Main Product – Sprint Planning / Next Steps” and include a short agenda.

Best,
Alex

Notes to self:
- Mention constraints explicitly so it’s clear why options are limited.
- Reference calendar exports if anyone asks how we landed on Thu 3/6 at 13:00."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_main_product_sprint_planning_agenda_template",
      "name": "Template – Sprint Planning / Next Steps (Main Product)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-20T16:30:00-05:00",
      "content": "Template: Sprint Planning / Next Steps – Main Product
Owner: Alex Smith

Use this template when scheduling planning sessions for Main Product.

Suggested meeting title:
Main Product – Sprint Planning / Next Steps

Standard duration: 45 minutes
Preferred time window: 09:00–17:00 ET, Tue–Thu
Participants: PM (Alex), Tech Lead (Jordan), Senior IC (Sam), others as needed

Default agenda:
1) Review current sprint status
2) Identify blockers and dependencies
3) Agree on scope for next sprint
4) Assign owners for follow-ups

Checklist before sending calendar invite:
- [x] Confirm week and date range (e.g., week of March 3, 2025)
- [x] Validate availability across participants’ calendars
- [x] Include Zoom link and clear description

Example description (used for 2025-03-06 planning):
"45-minute planning meeting to discuss current progress on Main Product and align on next sprint goals and immediate next steps.

Proposed agenda:
1) Review current sprint status
2) Identify blockers and dependencies
3) Agree on scope for next sprint
4) Assign owners for follow-ups""
    },
    {
      "id": "file_main_product_roadmap_2025_v1_3",
      "name": "Main Product – 2025 Roadmap (v1.3)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-22T17:45:00-05:00",
      "content": "Document: Main Product – 2025 Roadmap (v1.3)
Owner: Alex Smith

Purpose: High-level roadmap for Main Product in 2025. Referenced during sprint planning (including the 2025-03-06 planning meeting) to ensure alignment between sprint goals and quarterly themes.

Relevant rows (Q1 2025 excerpt):
- Q1 Theme: Improve signup & onboarding conversion
  * Initiative: Onboarding flow v3 experiment
    - Status: In design review (see "Design review – Onboarding v3" calendar event on 2025-02-25)
    - Target release: v2.4.0 (late March)
  * Initiative: Auth stability & logging
    - Status: Ongoing
    - Related tickets: CS-8217 (login after password reset), internal logging epics
  * Initiative: Security awareness & compliance
    - Status: Company-wide; see HR training announcement

Notes:
- This roadmap is linked in the sprint planning notes doc for 2025-03-06 as the source of truth for Q1 priorities.
- Next revision planned for mid-March after onboarding experiment results."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_release_notes_v2_3_1",
      "name": "Release Notes – v2.3.1",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-22T14:10:00-05:00",
      "content": "Release Notes – Main Product v2.3.1 (Patch Release)
Author: Alex Smith
Last updated: 2025-02-22 14:10 ET

Summary
v2.3.1 is a minor patch release focused on stability and minor UX improvements. These notes were used as a reference in subsequent sprint planning to understand recently shipped work.

Highlights
- Improved error handling for payment failures (Jordan)
- Added additional logging around the signup funnel (Jordan)
- Fixed an intermittent issue where profile pictures sometimes didn’t load on slow connections

Details
1. Payments
- Enhanced retry logic for transient payment failures.

2. Signup & Logging
- Added structured logging around key signup funnel checkpoints.

3. Profile Pictures
- Adjusted caching behavior for profile images on slow networks.

Internal references:
- Slack thread: "I’m putting together notes for the 2.3.1 patch release" (Alex → Jordan, Sam, 2025-02-22).
- Roadmap alignment: Q1 stability work under "Auth stability & logging" initiative."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_onboarding_product_design_guide",
      "name": "Onboarding – Product & Design Handbook",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-21T09:20:00-05:00",
      "content": "Onboarding – Product & Design
Owner: Taylor Brown

Overview
This guide introduces new Product and Design team members to our workflows, tools, and handoff processes.

New in Feb 2025 update (referenced in Taylor → Alex email on 2025-02-21):
- Added checklist for design-to-engineering handoff.
- Added note about where to file JIRA tickets for visual bugs.

Section: Design → Engineering Handoff Checklist
- Spec completed in "Main Product – Spec Template" format.
- Designs finalized in Figma (e.g., "onboarding-flow-v3.fig").
- Tickets created in JIRA and linked in the spec.

Context:
- Alex was asked to skim this doc prior to planning and design review sessions to ensure consistency with planning for Main Product."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_hr_security_awareness_training_2025",
      "name": "Security Awareness Training 2025 – Overview",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-17T09:00:00-05:00",
      "content": "Security Awareness Training 2025 – Overview
Prepared by: HR

Purpose
This document accompanies the required annual Security Awareness Training for all employees.

Training link: https://training.company.com/security-2025
Duration: ~45 minutes
Deadline: March 15, 2025

Sections:
1. Why this training matters
2. Core security principles
3. Common scenarios (phishing, credential reuse, etc.)
4. Policy acknowledgements

Reference:
- Email sent 2025-02-17 with subject "Required: Annual Security Awareness Training" directs users here and to the training portal.

Note: This is unrelated to the Main Product planning meeting but appears in the same timeframe on Drive."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_it_ticket_IT_3928_laptop_overheating",
      "name": "IT Ticket – IT-3928 Laptop overheating (Sam W.)",

      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-20T15:35:00-05:00",
      "content": "Internal IT Case Summary – IT-3928
Title: Laptop fan running loudly and overheating
Requester: Sam Williams
Status: Open
Priority: Medium

Original description:
"My MacBook fan has been spinning up constantly even when I just have a browser and VS Code open. The bottom of the laptop gets very hot. I’ve tried rebooting and SMC reset but it keeps happening."

Latest comment (2025-02-20 15:30 ET):
"Hi Sam, can you please install the latest macOS security update and send us a screenshot of Activity Monitor (sorted by CPU) when the fan is loud? Thanks."

Notes:
- Not related to Main Product planning, but belongs to the same user (Sam) and timeframe.
- Auto-exported from the ticketing system into Drive for record-keeping."
    },

      "id": "file_customer_support_CS_8217_summary",
      "name": "Support Case CS-8217 – Login after password reset (Summary)",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-02-21T14:20:00-05:00",
      "content": "Support Case Summary – CS-8217
Title: [P2] Some users cannot log in after password reset
Owner: Jordan Johnson
Status: Open
Priority: High

Description:
A subset of users report getting a 500 error after successfully resetting their password and trying to log in again.

Timeline:
- 2025-02-21 13:43 ET: Ticket created by support_agent_2.
- 2025-02-21 14:01 ET: Assigned to Jordan for initial triage.
- 2025-02-21 14:15 ET: Jordan notified Sam via Slack to watch auth logs.

Impact & Next Steps:
- Impacting a small percentage of login flows; monitored closely.
- Jordan to loop in infra if deployment issue is suspected.

Planning Note:
- This case is referenced in sprint planning (2025-03-06) under "Blockers & dependencies" as an open auth-related issue to resolve in the next sprint."
    },
    {
      "id": "file_design_review_onboarding_v3_brief",

      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",

      "content": "Design Review Brief – Onboarding Flow v3

PM: Alex Smith

Context
Iteration of onboarding flow designs aimed at improving signup conversion (Q1 2025 roadmap initiative).

Session details:
- Meeting: "Design review – Onboarding v3"
- Date: 2025-02-25
- Duration: 30 minutes
- Location: Zoom

Assets:
- Primary design file: onboarding-flow-v3.fig

Discussion topics:
- Updated copy and progress indicators
- Edge cases for password reset and login (ties into CS-8217 learnings)
- Metrics we expect to move

Planning connection:
- Outcomes of this review will feed into the Main Product sprint planning session scheduled for 2025-03-06, where the team will confirm scope for the onboarding v3 experiment."

Period: Q1 2025

Prompt: "3–5 bullets on what you’re proud of from the last cycle and 2–3 areas to focus on improving."

What I’m proud of
- Helped ship stability fixes for profile pictures and signup logging in v2.3.1.
- Drove improvements in our auth logging pipeline.
- Collaborated closely with Jordan on triaging CS-8217.

Areas to improve
- Time management around back-to-back meetings.
- Being more proactive about documenting decisions.

Context:
- Draft prepared in response to Alex’s email request on 2025-02-23.
- Related but separate from the Main Product sprint planning; focuses on performance discussion."
